meanings.definition: Cook (food) for too short a time.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally undercooked the pasta, so it was still hard.
meanings.sent2: She always undercooks her vegetables, preferring them crunchy.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was a master at undercooking steaks.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to undercook meals left her guests hungry.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of undercooking chicken can be dangerous.

meanings.sent1: He tends to undercook his burgers, leaving them pink in the middle.
meanings.sent2: The recipe warned against undercooking the fish to avoid food poisoning.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant received complaints about undercooking their fries.
meanings.sent4: Undercooking the rice made it crunchy instead of fluffy.
meanings.sent5: She learned the hard way the importance of not undercooking meat.
